info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.api

Class RewardApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.api.RewardApi

  • @Path(value="/reward")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public class RewardApi
extends Object
    A Reward will be awarded in dependent of the goal for a group or one person after a person fulfilled a task. A reward can be a permanent reward like a badge or achievement which can be obtained only once or a volatile reward such as coins, points or a particular level which can be earned several times and so can be changed by getting for example more coins or decrease the coins by giving a bid for an offer in the marketplace. Ancillary all possible types for creating a reward, all already created rewards for one particular organisation or with the associated id only one specific reward can be requested. For all rewards the name and description can be changed after they have been created. Dependent on the reward has an image or an amount of points respectively coins these attributes also can be changed.

    • Method Detail

      • getRewards

        @GET
 @Path(value="/*")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRewards(@QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                      String apiKey)
        Returns a list of all rewards associated with the passed API key and so all rewards which belong to a specific organisation. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response as List of Rewards in JSON.

      • getReward

        @GET
 @Path(value="/{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getReward(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                        String id,
                                                                        @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                        String apiKey)
        This method returns one specific player who is identified by the passed id and the API key. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - Required integer which uniquely identify the Reward.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Reward in JSON.

      • createNewReward

        @POST
 @Path(value="/")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createNewReward(@QueryParam(value="type") @NotNull
                                                                           String type,
                                                                           @QueryParam(value="name") @NotNull
                                                                           String name,
                                                                           @QueryParam(value="amount") @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                           String amount,
                                                                           @QueryParam(value="icon")
                                                                           String url,
                                                                           @QueryParam(value="description")
                                                                           String description,
                                                                           @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                           String apiKey)
        Creates a new reward and so the method generates the reward-id. The organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid API key is returned. It has to be defined which type of reward should be created, its name, description and respectively it is a permanent or a volatile reward an URL for the icon or the amount of coins or points.
        Parameters:
        type - The required type of the reward. A list of available reward types can be received by getRewardTypes(java.lang.String). The value of field can be "Achievement", "Badge", "Coins", "Points" and "ReceiveLevel".
        name - A string that represents the name of the reward.
        amount - If the type is a volatile reward like points or coins this parameter is used to represent their amount.
        url - If the type is a permanent reward like a badge or achievement this parameter represents the URL of the associated image.
        description - Optionally the description of the reward as String.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Reward in JSON.

      • getRewardTypes

        @GET
 @Path(value="/types")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRewardTypes(@QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                              String apiKey)
        Returns a list of all available reward types associated with an API key that can can created. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response a String with all types of a Reward in JSON.

      • createAchievement

        @POST
 @Path(value="/achievement")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createAchievement(@QueryParam(value="name") @NotNull
                                                                                        String name,
                                                                                        @QueryParam(value="description")
                                                                                        String description,
                                                                                        @QueryParam(value="url")
                                                                                        String url,
                                                                                        @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                        String apiKey)
        Creates a new reward of type achievement so the method generates its reward-id. The organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid API key is returned. Optionally the URL for an icon can be passed and a description for the achievement.
        Parameters:
        name - The required name of the achievement.
        description - Optionally a short text can be set to describe the achievement.
        url - Optionally the URL of an image can be set that is associated with the achievement.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Achievement in JSON.

                                                                                  String apiKey)

        Parameters:
        name - The required name of the coins reward.
        description - Optionally a short text can be set to describe the reward.
        amount - The required amount of coins greater then zero that can be earned.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Coins in JSON.

      • createReceiveLevel

        @POST
 @Path(value="/level")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createReceiveLevel(@QueryParam(value="name") @NotNull
                                                                                   String name,
                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="description")
                                                                                   String description,
                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="amount") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                                   String index,
                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                   String apiKey)
        Creates a new reward of type level so the method generates its reward-id. A level can be a number or a status like novice or expert in the area of specific tasks. The organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid API key is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - The required name of the level can be set.
        description - Optionally a short text can be set to describe the level.
        index - The required level index greater then zero.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of ReceiveLevel in JSON.

                                                                                             String rewardId,
                                                                                             @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                             String apiKey)

        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.

      • changeAchievement

        @PUT
 @Path(value="/{id}/changeAchievement")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response changeAchievement(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                                                  String rewardId,
                                                                                                  @QueryParam(value="attribute") @NotNull
                                                                                                  String attribute,
                                                                                                  @QueryParam(value="value") @NotNull
                                                                                                  String value,
                                                                                                  @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                                  String apiKey)
        With this method the fields of one specific achievement can be changed. For this the reward id, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and the new field's value are needed. To modify the name and description the new string has to be transfered with the attribute field. For a new icon the path of the new image is needed in the attribute parameter. The format of the image has to be .jpg or .png. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        rewardId - Required integer which uniquely identify the Reward.
        attribute - The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required. The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field: "name", "description" and "icon".
        value - The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Reward in JSON.

 @Path(value="/{id}/changeBadge")

                                                                                      String rewardId,

        @PUT
 @Path(value="/{id}/Points")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response changePointReward(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                                       String rewardId,

                                                                                       String apiKey)
        With this method the fields of one specific point reward can be changed. For this the reward id, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and the new field's value are needed. To modify the amount of points the new amount has to be transfered with the attribute field. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:

        attribute - The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required. The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field: "amount".
        value - The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Reward in JSON.

      • changeLevel

        @PUT
 @Path(value="/{id}/ReceiveLevel")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response changeLevel(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                                       String rewardId,
                                                                                       @QueryParam(value="attribute")
                                                                                       String attribute,
                                                                                       @QueryParam(value="value")
                                                                                       String value,
                                                                                       @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                       String apiKey)
        With this method the fields of one specific level reward can be changed. For this the reward id, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and the new field's value are needed. To modify the name and amount of the level the new name respectively amount has to be transfered with the attribute field. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        rewardId - Required integer which uniquely identify the Reward.
        attribute - The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required. The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field: "amount" and "name".
        value - The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Reward in JSON.

      • deleteReward

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="/{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteReward(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                              String id,
                                                                              @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                              String apiKey)
        Removes a specific reward from the data base which is identified by the passed id and the API key. But only if it is not associated to a goal. Then first the goal has to deleted. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - Required integer which uniquely identify the Reward which should be deleted.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this reward belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Reward with 200 OK and JSON as response type.
